bibl.note: This document is a letter written by Neill & Harley to John Dickenson on May 22, 1815. In the letter, Neill & Harley notify Dickenson that they have recommended him to a Mr. Samuel Ferguson, a merchant in New York, to collect debts for him in Nashville, Tennessee.

div.p: We have this day recd. received a letter from Mr. Samuel Ferguson of New York, requesting us to recommend to him a Suitable Person in Nashville to collect a debt for him, we have recommended you to him, & have Enclosed this letter to him as an introductory letter to you. Mr. Ferguson is a friend of ours & we trust you will use your customary diligence in transacting any business he may entrust you with Mr Ferguson is a respectable Merchant living in the City of New York & we hope this introduction may be equally advantageous
